cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the algorithmic curation of online conversations, which involves predicting the length of discussion threads and whether users will contribute to them again. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Computation and Language (cs.CL), or Information Retrieval (cs.IR), as these areas often deal with analyzing and predicting user behavior in online communities. Additionally, the paper mentions using network structure and arrival patterns, which could also relate to Machine Learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses the use of learning-based approaches, which could suggest a connection to Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI).
